column4: hi, i am a complete newbie. i have a friend who has a virus infested computer running xp. he would normally just format his c: drive, but he has lots of pictures of his daughter that he would like to keep. i had the idea of booting with and installing ubuntu, then deleting everything except the pictures. would that work? if so, how would it be done? thanks
try a liveCD and move the pix to a USB stick
once you save the pix ... wipe it any way you want ... but if you're going to install Ubuntu and used that liveCD, it's got an install icon on the desktop
make two copies of the pix, they're irreplaceable, I presume
